name: Noir Italia I
description:
Inspired by the Italian films of the mid-century... memories that live like soft, hazy dreams within my soul. After traveling through Italy in the Summer of 2011, this much coveted collection of Polaroid prints became a best seller. They are now being reissued exclusively for this print shop.

Each photograph in this series was shot with a vintage Polaroid 680SLR camera and expired black and white Polaroid film. Fine art prints are printed on archival, acid-free paper and protected with a lustre coating to maintain archival integrity. 20x20 and 30x30 prints are mounted on mat board.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.

name: No. 1
description:
Life and death. Art and science. 

I spent two incredibly magical afternoons in November of 2010 hand selecting the specimens in the 'Feather & Bone' collection with the generous support and aid of the Vertebrate Zoology Collections Manager at University of Colorado Museum of Natural History. 

There was something spiritual about being in the presence of such carefully cultivated history. Opening the drawers of the specimen cabinets to reveal what hidden treasures - in form of feather and bone - lay within. Hand scribed notes detailing the dates and locations each dated further in time than the last. The light granted me that day washed across the specimens with a gentle touch and ignited the new found power within their feathers, skins and bones - to teach new generations about their history and relevance. Magical.

Each photograph in this series was shot with a vintage Polaroid 680SLR camera. Fine art prints are printed on archival, acid-free paper and protected with a lustre coating to maintain archival integrity. 20x20 and 30x30 prints are mounted on mat board.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.

name: No. 16
description:
Life and death. Art and science. 

I spent two incredibly magical afternoons in November of 2010 hand selecting the specimens in the 'Feather & Bone' collection with the generous support and aid of the Vertebrate Zoology Collections Manager at University of Colorado Museum of Natural History. 

There was something spiritual about being in the presence of such carefully cultivated history. Opening the drawers of the specimen cabinets to reveal what hidden treasures - in form of feather and bone - lay within. Hand scribed notes detailing the dates and locations each dated further in time than the last. The light granted me that day washed across the specimens with a gentle touch and ignited the new found power within their feathers, skins and bones - to teach new generations about their history and relevance. Magical.

Each photograph in this series was shot with a vintage Polaroid 680SLR camera. Fine art prints are printed on archival, acid-free paper and protected with a lustre coating to maintain archival integrity. 20x20 and 30x30 prints are mounted on mat board.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.

name: Crystal Quartz
description:
Crystal Quartz is an incredibly diverse healing tool, and crystal balls and pendants continued to be used today to connect one to higher planes of awareness - just as they have been for thousands of years. The ancient Greeks called the clear stone "krystallos", meaning "clear ice" - they believed that is was in fact ice that could not melt and a gift from the Gods. Crystal Quartz is the modern birthstone of those born in April and under the sign of Aries.

Fine art prints are printed on archival, acid-free paper and protected with a lustre coating to maintain archival integrity. 20x20 and 30x30 prints are mounted on mat board.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.

name: Pearl
description:
In Japanese folklore, Pearls were thought to be the tears of a mermaid-like sea goddess named Ningyo. They were also believed for sometime to have been gifts from the Gods that fell from the sky into the great oceans. Julius Caesar was so enamored with them he decreed only aristocrats were allowed to wear Pearls and collected them with passion until his untimely death. It is the birthstone of those born in June.

Fine art prints are printed on archival, acid-free paper and protected with a lustre coating to maintain archival integrity. 20x20 and 30x30 prints are mounted on mat board.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.

name: Agate
description:
Agate has been mined throughout the world and has been used for thousands of years in ornamentation as both carvings and protective amulets. It was once believed to grant it's bearer the power of invisibility. It's used to balance and heal. Agate is the ayurvedic  birthstone of those born in May and associated with both the signs of Gemini and Cancer.

Fine art prints are printed on archival, acid-free paper and protected with a lustre coating to maintain archival integrity. 20x20 and 30x30 prints are mounted on mat board.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.

name: Garnet
description:
The ancient Romans attributed Garnet to their God of War, Mars and believed that the stone symbolized fire. Throughout the Middle Ages, it was believed to enliven passion in the wearer. Today the stone is used to bring about prosperity and pleasure. It is the modern and ayurvedic birthstone of January and associated with both Scorpio and Aquarius. 

Fine art prints are printed on archival, acid-free paper and protected with a lustre coating to maintain archival integrity. 20x20 and 30x30 prints are mounted on mat board.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.

name: Ruby
description:
In Egypt it was once believed that if a woman wore a Ruby against her skin, she would experience a lifetime of love and happiness. The ancient Burmese, who at the height of their glory owned and operated the largest Ruby mines in the world, believed the stone made them invincible, and warriors would insert pieces just under their skin before battle. It is the modern and ayurvedic birthstone of January and linked to Capricorn and Taurus.

Fine art prints are printed on archival, acid-free paper and protected with a lustre coating to maintain archival integrity. 20x20 and 30x30 prints are mounted on mat board.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.

name: Amber
description:
Amber is an organic compound that takes millions of years to realize. It is believed to be one of the very first stones used by humans as a talisman and jewelry. Throughout history, Amber has been considered a vessel of eternal youth, a symbol of eternal bonds, and an amulet against evil spirits, and it has been worn to enhance fertility and healing. It is associated with the sign of Leo.

Fine art prints are printed on archival, acid-free paper, mounted on matboard and protected with a lustre coating to maintain archival integrity. Each print is hand signed on the back and wrapped with care.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.

name: Pyrite
description:
Pyrite has been symbolically associated with fire because it will spark when struck by iron. Mesoamerican civilizations used the stone as a scrying mirror (used to see the future) because of it's reflective properties. Pyrite is thought to bring luck, wealth and success to it's bearer. It is also used to build confidence and promote sexual expression.

Fine art prints are printed on archival, acid-free paper, mounted on matboard and protected with a lustre coating to maintain archival integrity. Each print is hand signed on the back and wrapped with care.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.

name: Citrine
description:
The Greeks honored Citrine for it's ability to fill one's life with joy and it was believed to bring it's owner good luck and prosperity. Citrine is now used widely in the metaphysical realm of healing. Some practitioners believe it to be one of the most powerful stones for realizing one's creative potential and restoring financial health. It is an alternate birthstone for November and linked to Gemini.

Fine art prints are printed on archival, acid-free paper, mounted on matboard and protected with a lustre coating to maintain archival integrity. Each print is hand signed on the back and wrapped with care.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.

name: Peridot
description:
In the Middle Ages, Peridot was thought to act as a powerful talisman against evil and demons. It was also used to counter nightmares and frighten away ghosts. As a tool of "increase" in gem therapy, Peridot is believed to build wealth, health, emotional stability and insight. It is thought to the original birthstone for September and is the modern birthstone of August. It is also linked to Libra.

Fine art prints are printed on archival, acid-free paper, mounted on matboard and protected with a lustre coating to maintain archival integrity. Each print is hand signed on the back and wrapped with care.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.

name: Fluorite
description:
Highly prized during Roman times, Fluorite was most often crafted into drinking goblets and jewelry. Metaphysical beliefs hold that Fluorite purges negative energies and thoughts and aids in focusing and can even balance brain chemistry. It is associate with the month of February and in linked to both Pisces and Capricorn.

Fine art prints are printed on archival, acid-free paper, mounted on matboard and protected with a lustre coating to maintain archival integrity. Each print is hand signed on the back and wrapped with care.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.

name: Opal
description:
Tales of Arabian origin insist that Opal is what remains on Earth after the ground has been struck by lightening while Australian aboriginal myths are of the great Creator's footprints - every step the Creator left behind the precious stones. It's reputation as an ill omen was more the creation of jewelers of the early nineteenth century than bad luck - the stone breaks easily under pressure and jewelers attempted to protect themselves from the liability. It is recognized as the modern and ayurvedic birthstone of October and associated with Pisces. 

Fine art prints are printed on archival, acid-free paper, mounted on matboard and protected with a lustre coating to maintain archival integrity. Each print is hand signed on the back and wrapped with care.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.

name: Malachite
description:
Malachite has been used ornamentally since the Early Dynastic period in Egypt. Carved into protective amulets and powdered for pigments in both paintings and eye cosmetics, the stone was honored among Egyptians and thought to be part of God's physical realm. Several cultures have also linked Malachite to children - it was used as a teething stone and believed to keep evil from children and encourage a restful nights sleep. It is associated with the sign of Taurus.

Fine art prints are printed on archival, acid-free paper, mounted on matboard and protected with a lustre coating to maintain archival integrity. Each print is hand signed on the back and wrapped with care.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.

name: Aquamarine
description:
Mariners, who believed Aquamarine to be a gift from the mermaids, wore amulets of the stone engraved with the likeness of Poseidon, the sea god, to protect them. It was also common practice for sailors to carry small stone with them to toss into tempestuous seas to appease Poseidon. Even today, Aquamarine is thought to protect sailors and fishermen alike. It is the modern birthstone of March and linked to Scorpio.

Fine art prints are printed on archival, acid-free paper, mounted on matboard and protected with a lustre coating to maintain archival integrity. Each print is hand signed on the back and wrapped with care.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.

name: Turquoise
description:
Turquoise is one of the few stones to be worn by kings and common citizens alike. It still plays a vital role in the lives of traditional Navajo who rely on the stone stone's healing and protective charms. The Apache believed that a medicine man was powerless without the stone and Middle Eastern and Tibetan cultures alike still honor Turquoise for both medicinal and ritual purposes. It the birthstone of December and linked to Sagittarius.

Fine art prints are printed on archival, acid-free paper, mounted on matboard and protected with a lustre coating to maintain archival integrity. Each print is hand signed on the back and wrapped with care.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.

name: Labradorite
description:
Mythology about Labradorite says that the stone fell from the sky and that each specimen holds a blueprint of the universe within itself. Considered a stone of transformation, Labradorite is used to channel positive energy and inner strength. It is thought to calm one's anxieties and aid in seeing one's true self. 

Fine art prints are printed on archival, acid-free paper, mounted on matboard and protected with a lustre coating to maintain archival integrity. Each print is hand signed on the back and wrapped with care.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.

name: Topaz
description:
Used as a talisman throughout the ages, common uses for Topaz were to ward off the evil eye, to cure eye troubles, to fight depression and insomnia, to revitalize taste, and even to cure the plague (or so believed by a 15th century Roman physician). Topaz is the modern and ayurvedic birthstone for November and is associated with Sagittarius. 

Fine art prints are printed on archival, acid-free paper, mounted on matboard and protected with a lustre coating to maintain archival integrity. Each print is hand signed on the back and wrapped with care.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.

name: Lapis
description:
Once valued more than gold, Lapis was highly honored by ancient Egyptians who thought the stone gave great insight and even greater vision. It was worn as a talisman and believed that wearing the stone gave you the protection and love of the Gods. Lapis also forever changed the landscape of art history - grinding down the stone to a powder and mixing with binding agents resulted in the pigment ultramarine used heavily by the Old Masters. It is associated with Sagittarius and is an alternate birthstone for September.

Fine art prints are printed on archival, acid-free paper, mounted on matboard and protected with a lustre coating to maintain archival integrity. Each print is hand signed on the back and wrapped with care.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.

name: Amethyst
description:
Fine amethyst was once much rarer than it is today and was reserved for royalty. It was the stone set into Cleopatra's signet ring and the Egyptian Book of the Dead attributes the stone as the symbol of wisdom. It is used by metaphysical practitioners today to aid in both sobriety and calming unwelcome passions. It is the modern and ayurvedic birthstone of February and associated with Pisces, Virgo and Aquarius.

Fine art prints are printed on archival, acid-free paper, mounted on matboard and protected with a lustre coating to maintain archival integrity. Each print is hand signed on the back and wrapped with care.

Museum quality gallery canvas wraps are bonded and wrapped around 1 ½ inch of pine framing.  They are finished with a UV light protective semi-gloss laminate to protect from scratches, scuffs and cracking,  
and arrive fitted with hardware and are ready to hang.
